page.title: 12The Clink, Auchtermuchty
page.content: The farm is owned by{Mr. and Mrs. {Swan }who do most of the work themselves with extra help at busy times. Mr. Swan started farming the {Clink}in 1969. Much of the land around was owned by his grandparents and he himself always wanted to farm. The farm extends to{109 acres}and the soil is heavy to medium loam with rock near the surface. The livestock consists of approx. {150 free range hens.}The hens eat homegrown grain and concentrates. The graded eggs are sold locally. A horse grazing keeps the grass short to prevent the hens hiding their eggs. He has{30_40 cattle in Summer and up {to 80 in Winter.}He grows grass for silage and hay. He also grows{barley, {potatoes and oats.}Mr. Swan thinks that in{1733}the farm was owned by a man called{Klink}which became{Clink.
